definition:
For a given base $b$, [*Champernowne’s constant*]{} $C_b$ is the result
of concatenating the base $b$ digits of the positive integers in order
after 0 and a decimal point, that is,
$$\sum_{i = 1}^\infty \frac{i}{b^{\sum_{j = 1}^i k}}$$ (where $k$ is the
number of digits of $j$ in base $b$).

Kurt Mahler proved that $C_{10}$ (approximately
0.123456789101112131415161718192021...) is a transcendental number.
Champernowne had earlier proved that $C_{10}$ is a normal number.
